metadata.name: Sweeping #127
metadata.description:
Sweeping is a piece in which I explore the uses of noise fields. Using them in the most cliche way possible, but trying to make something unique out of that.

What started out as an innocent weekend project grew out to be quite the piece, which is why I am publishing it here.



Sweeping uses the GPU of your machine for its shading, which means it won't run particularly well on mobile devices. My recommended way of viewing this piece is on a PC with a dedicated GPU.

---

- Double Click to open a User Interface
- In the UI, you can toggle the paper texture and export

---

Made with p5js + webgl by Wouter Missler, 2022.

metadata.name: wallabye #28
metadata.description:
digital wallaby in its new blockchain environment made of Tezos API data
there are currently 3 species of wallaby classed as extinct in NSW, Australia - let's protect the remaining species so living on the blockchain is not their future

::: experimental p5.js, WEBGL API drawing - uses GPU to render preview
::: ** may be very slow or unresponsive on iOS browsers/devices **
::: blockchain API data is read from a file, not requested dynamically, to maintain a self-contained drawing for fxhash platform
::: API data as digital landscape / architecture / habitat
::: part of my specture series
::: 17/11/2022

metadata.name: Mixed Shapes #9
metadata.description: Mixed Shapes a grid gen art.

metadata.name: Pinwheel #202
metadata.description:
A pinwheel.

Created as part of the anniversary mint event #fxhashturnsone.

In fullscreen mode: double click, double tap or press 's' to save a still at the current resolution.

metadata.name: CENTURY-XXX-METAFRANKE #749
metadata.description:
1 of 5 in CENTURY-XXX, Series 2
Edition of 1000

Tribute to Herbert W. Franke
“In Honor of the Dinosaur of Computer Art” 

Herbert W. Franke, a pioneer of computer art, passed away on July 16, 2022 at the age of 95. CENTURY-XXX-METAFRANKE is an homage to Franke’s MONDRIAN software developed for the Texas Instruments TI 99/4 home computer in 1979, and it’s a fundraiser to digitize his archive:

“Our goal is to raise 20,000 Euro so that ZKM Karlsruhe can digitize Herbert W. Franke’s 1,800 manuscripts and make them publicly available. If we raise more money, it will be donated to the Rütgers Foundation which supports children and young adults in Africa so that they can get access to and work with technology.” 

Each frame, a single “pixel” is added to the CENTURY-XXX-METAFRANKE image. When the software first loads, 100,000 frames are run in the background to start things off. Keep it running for hours or days to see it transform entirely — it’s an “infinite animation.”

metadata.name: Prophecy #250
metadata.description:
Elder Futhark Runes / Proto-Germanic alphabets flowing through the canvas.

Each iteration gets a random rune from 24 runes and the vector field angles are based on that.

Also picks one word from what the random rune symbolizes as a prophecy for the next year.

Minted for #fxhashturnsone event 18.11.2022.

50% of primary profits to Processing Foundation.

Save image with 's'.

Load 2x or 4x dimensions (2560 * 3840px) image with '2' or '4'.

VGA 2022 / CC BY-NC 4.0

metadata.name: rflktr #86
metadata.description:
a generative artwork by Juhani Halkomäki

Celebrating my one year fxhash anniversary. The piece is based on my first project on fxhash, the Reflector. In this piece I continued the exploration on rays and reflection in 2D space. The end result is a colorful and fragile artwork with a hint of melancholy.

----

press 's' to save (only works after the piece has fully rendered)
press '1' to '9' to change the resolution

metadata.name: Slumbers #80
metadata.description:
Generative abstract artwork that explores forms, shapes, coloring and brushwork.

Options:

- press 'f' to turn off paper-like texture (recommended for print on hi-quality paper)
- press 's' to save the PNG image of the current view
- press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to save hi-res PNG images

Colors and textures might differ slightly on some devices due to the heavy use of low alpha blending. Calibrated and tested on Firefox 107.0 & Chrome 107.0.5304.107 on Win10 x64 Intel machine.

Created using p5js.

@VolatileMoods, November, 2022.
tags: slumbers volatile moods abstract generative painting colors brushwork

metadata.name: Learning to Fly #65
metadata.description:
This artwork renders a paper canvas-like texture and creates curves mimicking strokes of an ink pen.

It's coded entirely in p5.js and is best viewed on a screen bigger than a mobile phone, while listening to this track called ‘Learning to Fly' by Pink Floyd: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nVhNCTH8pDs

Artwork loads at 1000px by 1000px resolution by default. Press ‘2’,’4’ or ‘8’ to load as 2000px by 2000px, 4000px by 4000px or 8000px by 8000px respectively.

Press 's' at any time to download the rendered resolution.

metadata.name: HBDFXH01 #1
metadata.description:
Happy first birthday fxhash 🎂 🥳 😘

Press [s] in live view to save file as PNG.

This artwork was created using p5js and utilizes the p5.pattern library created by Taichi Sayama.

There are no rarity attributes assigned to this artwork, its value is intended to be determined by viewer aesthetic alone.

lisaorth.xyz
linktr.ee/lisaorthstudio
twitter: @lisaorthstudio

Splits:

25% of primary revenues go to KT1KYfj97fpdomqyKsZSBdSVvh9afh93b4Ge, the smart contract set up by Teia for donations for #Tezos4Iran, a charity fundraiser in solidarity with the protests and to raise awareness for women’s rights in Iran.

25% of primary revenues go to Women Who Code, an international nonprofit dedicated to empowering diverse women to excel in technology careers.

25% of primary revenues go to Savepakistan Flood Relief Fundraiser.

25% of primary revenues go to the Processing foundation.

metadata.name: Wish You Were Here #80
metadata.description:
This artwork was created while experimenting with noise fields and it instantly evoked a feeling of nostalgia in me. It's coded entirely in p5.js and renders domain warped flow fields on a paper canvas-like texture.

Please note that it takes about 5-10 seconds for the artwork to start loading. And it’s best viewed on a screen bigger than a mobile phone, while listening to this track called ‘Wish You Were Here' by Pink Floyd: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hjpF8ukSrvk

Artwork loads at 1000px by 1000px resolution by default. Press ‘2’,’4’ or ‘8’ to load as 2000px by 2000px, 4000px by 4000px or 8000px by 8000px respectively.
Press 's' at any time to download the rendered resolution.

metadata.name: gradient descent #61
metadata.description:
Whether by choice or circumstance, we often find our lives thrust into uncertainty. We're resilient, though — we find patterns in the chaos, deciphering and unraveling it piece by piece until a new comfort emerges. `gradient descent` is my expression of that cyclical flow that comes to dominate our lives.

The piece starts with comfort, a smooth gradient chosen from a curated palette. As the animation runs, that gradient is mutated by a unique sequence of linear transformations - slice, skew or stride on an underlying grid - as it descends into uncertainty. After a time the animation will reverse, peeling back each transformation and returning to comfort before beginning anew.

The menu - which can be accessed with a double click or Escape - gives you extensive control of the experience. I'd encourage you to explore these settings — they transform the feel of the piece, allowing you to adapt it to match your environment or mood. Any setting that can be changed in the menu can also be provided as a URL parameter - there's a button in the menu to export them all.

Built with raw WebGL 1.0, optimised to run smoothly on most devices.

Best viewed in full screen on large format displays.

||| controls

[hold space] ⇝ speed up
[esc/2xclick] ⇝ toggle menu
[g] ⇝ toggle gallery mode
[p] ⇝ toggle pause
[s] ⇝ capture current frame
[a] ⇝ capture all keyframes
[8/9/0/-] ⇝ change viewport

||| settings

All settings are configurable via the interactive menu. Initial values can be set as url parameters by adding &[name]=[value] to the url.

loop [1|0, default 1]
|  ⇝  loop the animation
infinite [1|0, default 0]
|  ⇝  generate a new sequence after each descent, constantly evolving
gallery [1|0, default 0]
|  ⇝  display in gallery mode with keyframes
quality [#, default 1]
|  ⇝  additional dpr scaling - lower to improve animation smoothness
speed [#, default 1]
|  ⇝  multiplier for step animation speed
step-pause [#, default 0.35]
|  ⇝  seconds to pause between keyframe steps
start-pause [#, default 4]
|  ⇝  seconds to pause at the initial keyframe
end-pause [#, default 4]
|  ⇝  seconds to pause at the final keyframe

||| capture

Capture current frame saves the still immediately, while capture all keyframes saves each of the keyframes sequentially. Some browsers may require confirmation to save multiple stills. When triggered early, unrendered keyframes will be blank. All captures are impacted by the following settings.

capture-aspect [#, default 1]
|  ⇝  aspect ratio of the capture, as width/height
capture-size [#, default 2048]
|  ⇝  longest dimension of the captures to save, in pixels



NFT License, who? 2022
webgl engine based on lightgl by evanw
